--- ray@a... wrote:
> Thanks Jeff.  That is very helpful.  It was really driving me
> up the wall.

Glad to help!

> I don't understand the point about replacing the private
> singleton instance variable, though.  How would that help?
> Wouldn't that ultimately leave me with the same problem,
> only within the singleton class?

Most often, singleton classes store the singleton instance in a 
private static variable in the class.  So I'm assuming that the 
DefaultGatewayController class contains a private static field to 
hold the reference to its own singleton instance.  My suggestion is 
that you could use reflection to change this private static field to 
point to instances you create.  On the other hand, maybe the 
singleton-ness of the class isn't an issue in your tests; maybe none 
of the code under test calls static methods of 
DefaultGatewayController to get the singleton instance.
_ _ _

It doesn't appear that you need to use a class loader.  It seems 
like you could just do this:

Constructor constructor =
DefaultGatewayController.class.getDeclaredConstructor(paramTypes); 

Then the instance created by this constructor would be directly 
usable by your test code.
